page.title: 16ST.MARY'S CHURCH ORGAN
page.content: { During 1985, St. Mary's church organ had to be restored. It had been{50 {years}since it was last over-hauled. Due to mechanical failure it was found that the leather, which made up the bellows, had to be replaced, wiring renewed and{1500 metal and wood pipes had to be cleaned and restored. During May 1985 the pipes had to be re-tuned by the organ builders, Bishop and Son, London. The total cost has been in excess of{Â£10,000.}The first time the organ was played for the public after its renovation was when {Gainford Choral Society}performed Beethoven's Mass (in C major) which proved to be, "a warm and spirited performance". We look forward to another{50 years}of organ music in our church.
